resources.string:
"The private keys generated by your app are sent.
Thank you for helping to break the chain of infection."
"Open the app to read the message"
"The app is not working because Bluetooth is turned off"
"The app is not working because Bluetooth is not permitted"
"Encounters will be recognised in the background via low energy Bluetooth."
"Encounters will be recognised in the background via low energy Bluetooth."
"Change the settings to receive information directly in the event of a report."
"This app provides a preview of how the DP-3T works. It is not a functioning COVID-19 tracker."
"This setting overwrites the app's visual status. Proximity tracing functionality remains unaffected."
"By entering the Covidcode, you tell the app that you have tested positive for the coronavirus."
"The FOPH recommends that anyone with COVID-19 symptoms should get tested. Call your doctor or your healthcare facility to schedule an appointment."
"Activate proximity tracing so that the app works."
"Turn on Bluetooth on your device so that proximity tracing works."
"Enable the use of Bluetooth so that proximity tracing works."
"Follow the government recommendations on hygiene and social distancing."
"You have tested positive for the coronavirus."
"Follow the instructions you receive on isolation."
"You have tested positive for the coronavirus."
"You could be infectious without realising it."
"Please protect your family, your friends and those around you. Avoid contacts for up to 10 days after a possible infection."
"If you have any questions: Infoline SwissCovid +41 58 387 77 78"
"Staying one step ahead of the virus"
"By using the SwissCovid app, we can all help to contain the spread of the coronavirus."
"The app tells you if you might have been exposed to the coronavirus."
"Devices only exchange random IDs. The app does not gather location data or data on your identity."
"The random IDs are stored on your device for 14 days and then deleted."
"The app automatically recognises when two users have been in close proximity for a certain time."
"It uses Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to do this. No GPS, mobile, Wi-Fi or other location data."
"The app tells you if you might have been exposed to the coronavirus."
"By responding appropriately, you can break the chain of infection and protect other people."
"In order to use the app, you must enable Bluetooth."
"No personal data is visible via Bluetooth."
"The app operates using as little energy as possible. There is only a minor increase in battery usage."
"In order to receive notifications from the app, you must enable messages."
"In the event of a potential infection, you will receive a message on the lock screen."

"Get well soon!
Follow the instructions you have received on isolation."
"Thank you for helping to break the chain of infection."
"It has not been possible to synchronise reports for some time. Please check that your device is connected to the internet."
"If you have any problems, call the office that gave you the Covidcode."
"The time must be set correctly for proximity tracing to work."
"An unexpected error has occurred. Restart your device."
"Go to \"Settings > General > Background App Refresh\" and ensure that \"Wi-Fi & Mobile Data\" is selected. Background App Refresh can then be activated individually for each app."
"Install the new version of the app so that proximity tracing works."
"An unexpected error has occurred. Please retry."
"Please enter the code in full, then press button."
"On Android devices, Bluetooth depends on location sharing. This means the location function must be enabled even though the app never accesses your location."
"Open the app to check the list of random IDs reported."
"If smartphones with the app are in close proximity for a certain time, this is registered on your device as an encounter."

"In the event of an encounter, only random IDs are exchanged.
They are saved locally on the smartphones and then deleted 14 days later."
"Does Bluetooth have to be turned on all the time?"
"In order to recognise encounters, Bluetooth must be turned on at all times. This causes only a minor increase in battery usage."

"The app checks regularly to see whether any users that you have encountered have reported testing positive for the virus.
If it is possible that you have been infected, you will receive a message on your lock screen."

"The app not only checks whether you have had encounters with infected persons, but how long and how close these were.
You will only be notified if there is sufficient likelihood that you have been infected."
"The infoline SwissCovid will advise you on getting a free test."

"It is recommended that you call every time you receive a notification.
You will remain anonymous. No personal data will be recorded.
The counselling is free of charge. You just have to pay for the call."

"People who test positive for coronavirus (with a PCR test or rapid antigen test) will receive a Covidcode.
This guarantees that only confirmed cases are reported via the app."

"Only the private keys from your app are sent, no personal data.
Other SwissCovid apps can then check if it is possible that they have been infected."
"Although no personal data relating to you is sent out, it may well be that someone remembers their encounter with you from the date."

"These are the most common symptoms of COVID-19:
– Fever, feverish feeling – Sore throat – Cough (mostly dry) – Shortness of breath – Body aches – Sudden loss of the sense of taste and/or smell
Other symptoms may include:
– Headache – General weakness, feeling unwell – Aching muscles – Head cold – Gastrointestinal symptoms (nausea, vomiting, diarrhoea, stomach ache) – Skin rash"
"After a positive test, tracing is automatically deactivated in the app. Tracing can be reactivated once you have completed your period of isolation."
"This button exits the app and opens the F.O.P.H. website."
"COVID-19 Exposure Notifications must be activated to use the app."
"Only random IDs are exchanged, not data about your location or your person."
"The app operates using as little energy as possible. There is only a minor increase in battery usage."
"Do you really want to delete the notification?"
"Do you really want to delete the notification? "
"To be able to recognise encounters at all times, the battery optimisation function for this app must be disabled."
"For the app to work, it must also run in the background. Battery optimisation can be disabled for individual apps, so that this is possible."
"The app operates using as little energy as possible. There is only a minor increase in battery usage."
"For proximity tracing to work precisely, the app must also run in the background. This will cause a minor increase in battery usage."
"Google Play Services is not up to date"
"Proximity tracing has been deactivated. Please restart it."
"Activate COVID-19 Exposure Notifications for proximity tracing to work."
"The message could not be sent. Please allow your random IDs to be shared with the SwissCovid app."

"To activate proximity tracing, an up-to-date version of Google Play Services is required.
If no update is currently available on your device, please try again later."
"An unexpected error occurred when synchronising the notifications"
"Secure connection to server not possible. Please check or deactivate your VPN or proxy, or check whether you are connected to a public Wi-Fi system."
"The app regularly checks the random IDs reported by users who have tested positive."
"SwissCovid remains active even if the app has been closed."
"Although no personal data relating to you is sent out, it may well be that someone remembers their encounter with you from the date."
"Does anyone find out who I am?"
"When the first symptoms appear, phone a doctor or health centre."
"COVID-19 Exposure Notifications must be activated to use the app."
"Here you will find the Data Protection Statement and Conditions of Use"
"Warning: This app does not protect you from COVID-19 infection."

"The app is intended for proximity tracing and to warn users of potential exposure to someone infected by COVID-19. It is not a diagnostic tool either. Please read the instructions provided in each app screen carefully."
"Federal Office of Public Health FOPH Schwarzenburgstrasse 157 3097 Liebefeld, Switzerland"
"Messages could not be checked because your mobile phone does not have enough free memory space. Please release memory space."
"There have already been too many requests today. The app will try again later."
"The SwissCovid Guide has information about the possibility of a free coronavirus test."
"Enable tracing so the app can save encounters and receive reports"
"If tracing is disabled, you cannot receive any reports."
"If tracing is disabled, you cannot receive any reports"

"You don’t have to install another app if you’re travelling in one of the compatible countries.
SwissCovid checks private keys published in the compatible countries. This means that you can also receive alerts of possible infection abroad."
"What happens when the Covidcode is entered?"

"When the Covidcode is entered, the private keys sent by you are also shared with the compatible countries.
To enable travellers from abroad to also receive alerts, this happens regardless of whether you yourself are travelling abroad or not."
"This button leaves the app and opens a website."
"Change the settings to receive notification outside the app as well in the event of a report."
"If as many people as possible activate the SwissCovid app, we can break infection chains early."
"If as many people as possible activate the SwissCovid app, we can break infection chains early."
"Open the system settings via the button below."
"If not done already, you can now set SwissCovid as active region."
"Answer the questions in the SwissCovid Guide to find out how to respond."
"If you have further questions, feel free to call the SwissCovid Infoline for information by phone."
"You can open the SwissCovid Guide again any time here."
"The notification of possible infection serves as the proof you need for a free coronavirus test. If you delete this notification you lose this proof and the link to the SwissCovid Guide."
"SwissCovid can remind you to reactivate tracing."
"You can be tested for the coronavirus at various doctors, test centres, hospitals and pharmacies. You will find information on the various testing facilities on the relevant cantonal websites:"
"Activate tracing so that the app can save contacts and receive notifications."
"For SwissCovid to work you must install the latest version of iOS."
"For SwissCovid to work you must install the latest version of iOS."

"Notifications will no longer be stored.
Tracing can be reactivated after isolation."

"Are you deaf or hard of hearing and unable to call the coronavirus infoline on the phone?
Send an email to covid-support@medgate.ch."
"Number of Covidcodes entered since the launch of the SwissCovid app in June 2020. This is the number of people who have notified their contacts of possible infection via the app."

"The percentage of Covidcodes entered already in the first two days after onset of symptoms. This figure is for the last 7 days.
Time is a crucial factor when it comes to combating coronavirus: the shorter the time between the onset of symptoms, the result of the test and entering the Covidcode, the earlier alerted contacts can stay at home and protect other people."
"Shows the average number of reported new infections per day over 7 days."
"Shows the change in the 7-day average compared with the situation a week ago."
"The chart shows new infections reported in the last 28 days. This gives an overview of current developments."
"Have you tested positive (PCR test or rapid antigen test) and did not receive a Covidcode after 4 hours? If so, contact the Coronavirus Infoline:"
"Tracing can be reactivated once you have completed your period of isolation."
"Travelling abroad? SwissCovid works in these countries."
"To enable travellers from abroad to receive alerts as well, the private keys are also shared with the coronavirus apps in compatible countries."

"All the people you came into contact with during the infectious period from {ONSET_DATE} until you entered the Covidcode will be notified, if there is a possibility of infection due to the proximity and duration of the contact."
"In this way you are helping break chains of infection."
"Your app's private key was sent for the following period:"
"When you enter a Covidcode, tracing needs to be activated so that your private key can be shared."
"If you press \"{BUTTON_TITLE}\", you leave the app and switch to the SwissCovid Guide website. The data on recent encounters with potentially infected people is sent to the website."

"You will also be notified if you have been in contact with someone who uses the German Corona-Warn-App and later tests positive, and vice versa. The terms of use and data protection statement have been updated accordingly."
"A coronavirus test is advisable and recommended from the 5th day after the displayed contact date."
"You can no longer check-in when you tested positive. More text more text more text more text more text more text more"

"Sharing your random IDs helps “SwissCovid” to notify other potential infected people and avoid the further spreading of the pandemic. If you don’t share your random IDs no automatically recognized encounters can be notified. "
